column1: pushed across full outside off, left alone
similar delivery, full outside off, hunting for some swing...through to the keeper
got him! Guptill's woes continue. Full at off stump, brings the drive this time, it skews off a thick outside half of the part and it's a regulation catch at backward point
length ball outside off, finds the middle of Williamson's bat as he cuts but straight to backward point
Williamson and New Zealand are away, dropped in a touch short by Sams, it's pulled from outside off through midwicket
through the off side this time, driving at a full delivery, splits the gap between point and backward point...third man is able to get around
starts with a big full toss, just gets pushed down to long-off for a single
uses his feet, makes it into a very full delivery which he flicks back down the pitch. Zampa and Seifert fall over each other
flatter delivery on the pads, tucked backward of square on the leg side
shorter delivery, he goes onto the back foot and drives into the covers
full at the toes, deflects through short third man, a strangled appeal for lbw
another full toss but it gets driven straight to cover
back of a length at off stump, played with an open face towards backward point
through him! That's a beauty. A rapid yorker goes under the bat and takes the base of off stump. Almost as though Seifert played over it
back of a length, 139kph, on the stumps and defended to the on side
full at off stump, gets it neatly through the off side with a drive
nudged into the on side
short of a length, straight, 139kph, Williamson goes for the pull but gets taken on the thigh pad and it balloons to the on side
a slower ball on the stumps, dabbed square into the off side
short of a length, pushed off the back foot into the covers
a yorker at off stump, 133kph, squeezed off the toe end
a bouncer over leg stump, sails over Williamson's head
just wide of midwicket! Came down the pitch, a short-of-a-length delivery, swings it hard through the leg side

bottom edge! This start gets better and better for Australia. Another short-of-a-length delivery, Williamson trying a repeat shot, this might have been more of a cutter, takes a thin bottom edge that just carries to Wade
length ball at middle and leg, 135kph, bobbles off the pads
short, down the leg side, doesn't make contact with the pull and gets the wide
another cracking delivery! Conway using his feet, Richardson bowled it a touch shorter, a cross-seamer, and there's movement away from the left hander to beat the outside edge
fuller at middle and leg, clipped through the leg side
tight on middle and leg, 137kph, beats the inside edge and takes him high on the pads
full outside off, gets forward and drives to cover

just over long leg! Conway whipped this off his pads, didn't try to keep it down, Sams leaps near the rope but can't get it. Could he have got it if he'd been right on the rope? Was probably always over him
full and straight, defended back to the bowler
full at off stump, 133kph, pushed to the covers
moves across the crease, tucks a length ball from around off stump into the leg side
back of a length at the stumps, played to the on side
lovely timing! Short of a length outside off, he leans on it with an open face and sends it through point
through the leg side this time, a similar length delivery but a touch straight, a short-arm pull to deep square leg
punched off the back foot into the covers
full and straight, worked to the on side
keeps it full, driven down the ground to long-off
worked off the stumps into the leg side
a shorter delivery, pushed off the back foot to the on side and Zampa gets across
full and straight, driven to cover where Philippe (minus the gloves) saves it with a dive but they get the single
round the wicket, full at leg stump, worked to long-on
round the wicket to the left hander, full outside off, flicked back to the bowler
brings out the reverse sweep and places it perfectly, a full delivery on the stumps, whips his wrists through the shot
a flatter delivery, tucked to the on side
conventional sweep this time, struck firmly from outside off to deep square leg
drives square through the off side, deep point can't stop the second
round the wicket, back of a length outside off at 139kph, pushed into the covers
length ball outside off, a punchy drive to the cover sweeper
full and straight, a bottom-handed whip finds midwicket
short of a length outside off, a well-timed back cut and it's intercepted by Agar at backward point
all the way! Gets underneath a short delivery, swivels on a pull and sends it into the crowd
adjusts the length, full outside off, defends as he comes across the crease
tucks a full delivery off his toes into midwicket
angled into the pads, worked to deep midwicket
steps back and drives to the cover sweep, placed nicely for the second
outside leg stump, goes for the sweep and it takes top edge or gloves. Loops in front of short fine leg
sweeps again, gets this squarer and picks the gap fine of deep backward square
and another sweep, and it's another boundary, beats Marsh for the second time in two balls so some momentum for New Zealand
launched over long on! Now they're rolling. Tossed up outside off but it's in the slot, a step hit and Phillips flushed it 87 metres
94kph, flatter on leg, he's back and tucking this behind square
quicker, leg break, on off, 96kph, he's hurried going back and forcing back to the bowler
full outside leg, he sweeps hard to deep backward square but the man is well placed
fractionally short and wide, he thrashes a cut shot and Philippe makes a good diving stop
dragged down and hammered over deep square! A long hop and Phillips was back and waiting, he could have hit it anywhere, he went square and cleared the fence
back of a length, 136kph, top of middle, he pushes back to the bowler
glided nicely past short third man! This outfield is lightning. Slower ball, shorter and wide, he just opened the face and guided it past Jhye Richardson on the circle
cracking pull shot! 121kph, short length again, it sat up at waist height and he rocked back and thumped it along the ground through square leg
133kph, good length, fourth stump, he drives on the up to long off
sky ball goes miles in the air and lands safe at the midwicket circle! Slower ball, he got under it and it went straight up but all the man are back on the fence on the leg side and it falls safe
shorter into the hip, he tucks this to the gap at midwicket
good length, top of middle, he pushes this slowly to long on who was on the rope, they run hard and pinch two as Agar fumbles running in

skied straight up to cover and Marsh holds on! A slower ball gets him. Cutter angled into leg, he loses his shape trying to launch this over wide long on, he sliced it straight up off a leading edge, it went a long way in the air, Marsh ran in from cover and took a good catch. Never easy when they go that high
back of a length, 129kph, fourth stump, he's back and forcing to deep cover
back of a length, off stump, he nearly chops on off the inside edge! It bounces past leg stump
129kph, fuller outside off, he drives elegantly on the up forward of point to the long boundary for two
slower ball on leg, he clips this through midwicket to bring up 50 off 36 balls. His 3rd in T20Is
darted into leg stump, he works it through midwicket
full on leg, he clips this wide of long on for two
drifting down leg and he lets it go for a wide
fired way wide down the leg side
shorter length on leg, he's back and tucking this forward of square for an easy two
drifting into off, he turns this from off stump to midwicket
shapes to reverse sweep, it drifts down leg and it's not a wide, Wade can't glove it cleanly and they get a bye
99kph, drifting into leg, he glances this around the corner
short slower ball, he pulls off the glove fine of fine leg for two
132kph, full toss wide of off, he slices a drive to backward point and Philippe dives to knock it down
132kph, back of a length on leg, he gets an inside edge onto thigh pad and it rolls to the square leg umpire but square leg is back and they pinch two again
130kph, full on middle, he defends this to the gap at cover

Maxwell knocks it onto the rope! What have you done Glenn? Flicked in the air off his pads to deep square, Sams runs around and knocks it down on the bounce, Maxwell goes to pick it up and knocks it onto the rope!
length ball wide of off, he square drives straight to backward point
slower ball outside off, he drags this straight to mid on on the circle
130kph, shorter length, he mistimes a pull past midwicket for a couple
lofted straight down the ground! Full slower ball outside off, he dragged it from wide and toed it but he hit it well enough to find the rope at the sightscreen
slower ball bouncer, he slips a pull in the air but it lands short of deep midwicket
139kph, short into the hip, he pulls powerfully behind square and Agar has to work hard to cut it off
one handed pull shot forward of square and it runs away from Agar! 114kph, short slower ball, he pulls taking one hand off the bat but he timed it well enough to run away in the gap
138kph, full outside off, he whips it with the bottom hand straight to deep forward square
he charges at a 139kph, wide yorker, he reaches out with one hand and slices it behind point for two
137kph, full and wide of off, he square drives with power to deep point
flicked wide of short fine! 103kph, slower ball and Neesham picked it, it drifted down leg and he flicked it with the bottom hand wide of short fine with ease
caught behind! This nipped away! 137kph, fuller length wide of off, Neesham leaned back to thrash a drive, it just nipped away and feathered a nick to the keeper Wade. Easy catch
135kph, good length, fourth stump line, he pushes this off the front foot to cover-point
131kph, short into the hip, he pulls to deep square leg
hammered through square leg! What a shot! Short cutter, it sat up, he swivelled and cracked it through square leg
yorker on leg, he glances this behind square into the gap for two
yorker, speared into leg, 133kph, he clips this forward of square to the man in the deep
bouncer, 131kph, he pulls, mistiming it through midwicket
low full toss, 135kph, on middle, he drives to long off
133kph, wide yorker beats the bat. Well bowled
slower ball wide of off, he square drives on the up to the gap at deep point for two
short slower ball dragged way wide of off
flicked over fine leg! Full speed angled into leg stump, he stayed still and flicked it over short fine and it went all the way
lofted to wide long off and Stoinis can't get there! It hung in the air for a long time, Stoinis ran a long way but just couldn't get there
cracked past cover! Half volley wide of off, he go down on one knee and smoked it past cover in the circle
wide slower ball, he reaches out and slaps this to deep point
133kph, low full toss on leg, he clips this behind square to the sweeper
thumped through midwicket! 115kph, short slower ball, he stood up and got on top of the bounce to smash it wide of long on and straight of deep midwicket
Wade misses the run out! A length ball beats the bat, Conway runs, Wade has the glove off already, he fires and misses!
It costs six! Launched over midwicket! Length ball in the slot, he's sitting deep and just swings beautifully to clear the fence
creamed along the ground wide of mid on! Low full toss, he used the bottom hand to drag it wide of mid on who was up!

wide full toss hammered straight to deep point! They don't run two! It was hit so hard straight to the man he didn't even try for two. He would have been run out but they probably could have tried. Conway finishes 99 not out!
full outside off, left alone
well bowled, this nips back off the seam and cramps Wade for room, chops it down by his feet
good length, straight, worked into midwicket
full outside off, he comes across the crease and drives, gets a thick inside edge into the boot
taken at point! This came out of the middle from Finch, but didn't keep it down. Driving on the up outside off, nicely taken by the man of the moment Devon Conway
full at off stump, 131kph, defended firmly to mid-on. Terrific start from Southee
that's a ripper! Back of a length at off stump and swings away to bat the outside edge
that's adventurous from Wade...walks across outside off and tries to scoop a short-of-a-length delivery. Gets taken on the forearm
fuller outside off, drives up and over the off-side ring, not quite out of the middle
short of a length, straight, worked in front of square leg
and another...both sides having early problems! It's a brief first innings for Philippe, looking to work this through the leg side and gets a big top edge. Another catch for Conway
swings this down the leg side
full and straight, pushed to mid-on
takes another blow on the body as he attempts to pull a short delivery which rushes onto him...top edge into the helmet
an appeal for lbw as Wade swings across the line to a full delivery that shapes back in...might have been bat, yes there was
full outside off, driven to midwicket
this comes out slightly wrong, it's a low full toss, clipped firmly but straight to deep square leg
that's a beauty! In the channel outside off, straightens off the seam to beat Marsh's edge
walks at the bowler, the bottom hand comes off the bat as he drives on the up to cover
makes a good connection this time! A successful scoop, gets underneath a short-of-a-length delivery and clears fine leg
carved into the off side, taken at mid-off! Wade trying to go over the covers, comes off the toe end of the bat and it's a simple catch
short of a length at middle and leg, hits the splice hard as he defends to the off side
more sharp seam movement, this jags back from short-of-a-length and cuts Maxwell in half
stays leg-side of the ball, back of a length, steers it through backward point with an open face
starts outside leg and swings further so that's called wide
pushed across outside off, left alone
good length, angled in at the pads, played to midwicket
shorter and down the leg side
edged, sharp catch at second slip! Australia falling apart under the Christchurch lights. Pitched up outside off, Maxwell drives on the up away from his body. Nicely taken by Neesham
lovely bowling, full outside off, hint of shape away and left alone
pitched up outside off, through to the keeper
back of a length, straight, nudged through midwicket
whipped over midwicket...that flew off the bat. Full, angled into the pads, Marsh shows his power although it briefly had the fielder interested
short and wide, square cuts down to third man
short of a length outside off, Marsh fetches it from quite wide and pulls high over midwicket. Not quite coming out properly for Jamieson
that's better! Back of a length outside off, this climbs past the outside edge...was reasonably wide, Marsh feeling for it
there's the inswinger, full outside off, shapes in sharply to the stumps, defended to mid-on
crunched! There's Marsh's power again. Short of a length, Marsh is sitting back and pulls it with immense force in front of square
short outside off, steered down to third man. Jamieson looks at the bottom of his boots
starts with a short ball, pulled backward of square and beats the diving fielder
this is fuller, defended to the on side
full and straight, tucked wide of mid-on
back of a length, tucked off the pads through square leg
length ball outside off, a slower ball, driven to deep cover
pulls another short ball, not quite out of the middle this time, deep square leg slips a little as he fields
a straight full toss, worked wide of a diving mid-on and deep square leg hasn't a chance to get around
very wide outside off...hasn't been the best of starts by big Kyle
short of a length outside off, Marsh aims another big pull but doesn't make contact this time
that's a better delivery, gets it very full outside off, swings late and beats the edge as Marsh jabs down
this is full but very wide, throws his hands into a drive which finds deep point
driven in the air but through the covers to the sweeper
low full toss outside off, picks out cover as he drives
lands the first one nicely, full at off stump, played to backward point
full at leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
dragged down short but Stoinis can't make contact as he pulls
short of a length outside off, he leans back and square drives with enough power to beat the sweeper
short ball, straight back to the bowler! A bit of a long hop, really. Stoinis looked a little rushed as he tried to pull and skews it at chest height to Sodhi
drives down to long-off
round the wicket, touch short, pulled to long-on
full outside off, goes for the slog sweep and it skids under the bat
paddles this one off the stumps, trickles through short fine leg
full outside off, drives to long-off
full outside off, hint of turn, driven to the cover sweeper
down the leg side, no contact with anything and they take a run as well as it rebounds off the keeper
through him! How did that not clean him up? Marsh somehow surives
79kph, shorter leg break, he cracks this off the back foot wide of long off, Guptill makes a great diving save on the rope
launched over midwicket with the spin! Tossed up in his arc, he made a good stride and swung with the turn launching it high over the deep midwicket fence
shorter and wider of off, he cuts hard to deep cover-point
86kph, full slider out of the front of the hand, he mistimes a back foot drive back to the bowler
advances to drive on the up, chops an inside edge that bounces to Seifert and he has to reach back into his crease before the keeper whips the bails off
cut powerfully behind point! It was fractionally short, he was back and slashing this so hard behind point and Phillips couldn't get there
he steps outside off and heaves this along the ground to deep forward square
advances and slices a drive high in the air towards deep point but Conway can't get there running in
thick edge flies fine! Short and wide, he flashed at a cut shot, got a thick edge and it runs away fine with no slip in
95kph, into the pitch, he drives on the up without great timing to long off
steps outside off early, exposes the stumps and sweeps hard behind square, Guptill comes around to cut it off
good length outside off, he sweeps hard again forward of square this time, Guptill works hard to his left and keeps it to one
133kph, full outswinger, he sets himself and tries to launch down the ground, gets a thick edge that runs through square leg

steps outside off and flicks this beautifully behind square! Classy shot. A length ball outside off, Agar stepped inside the line and flicked it with ease into the gap between deep backward square and fine leg
short ball, he miscues a pull and it balloons just over Williamson at midwicket. He was in close
pulled over wide fine leg! 108kph slower ball gone wrong. It was a drag down on the hip, he swivelled and pulled it high over the fence
cut straight to Santner! Sharp chance taken at backward point! Short and wide, he leaned back flayed a cut shot hard and flat but Santner dives to his right and catches it nicely at chest height
137kph, back of a length into the hip, he works this to fine leg
leg break, drifting into leg, it hits the pad and rolls away

top edge straight up to short fine! Simple catch for Jamieson. Shorter on leg, it bounced a touch more than he expected, he was trying to pull it over deep square and got a top edge that went straight up, Jamieson moves to his right and takes it easily
slider, zips through outside off, beats the bat as he tries to drive off the back foot

thick edge and a superb catch from the big man Jamieson diving forward at short third man! Leg break tossed up very high outside off, it was a half volley, Agar gives himself room to thrash it through point, gets a thick edge that carries all the way to short third man and Jamieson dives forward
86kph, short leg break, he's back and pulling to deep backward square, there's a slight fumble on the rope
beaten by a beautifully flighted 83kph, leg break that spins past the edge
back of a length, turning, he tries to work to leg but gets a leading edge back to the bowler
shorter length, he's back and pulling in the air but it lands just short of deep midwicket running in
tossed up on leg, he drives firmly to long on
shorter and wider of off, he reaches out and mistimes it
darted into off, 91kph, he's back and turning this around the corner
slower and wider of off, he leaves as it's called wide
short and wide, he's back and punching this firmly wide of long off to pick up a couple
tossed up leg break outside off, he drives firmly to long off

lofted straight down long off's throat! Sodhi has four! Tossed up outside off, Kane tries to loft with the spin over long off, he struck ok but not well enough to clear the man in the deep and it's a simple catch
short ball, down leg, he tries to pull but misses. It's not called wide. Might have hit Jhye's body
tossed up wide of off, he drives firmly to long off
high full toss! This slipped out but it was well wide of off
advances and gets a thick edge that runs away! He charged to a loopy leg break, tried to drive hard to long off, he got a thick edge and it runs to the third man boundary
short and wide, he's back and cutting hard to deep point
134kph, short ball outside off, he pulls in the air but with no timing to deep midwicket
thick inside edge runs past leg stump and away! A length ball angled into off, he swung hard and got a thick edge but it missed leg and ran away
short ball, 131kph, angled in and cramping him, he miscues in the air just out of reach of Neesham at midwicket
130kph, bouncer, he swings hard and misses
length slower ball, 117kph, he heaves this on the up to long on
good length, 134kph, angled into the pads and it runs away into the off side for a leg bye
shorter length, he's back and working this through midwicket
advances and lofts this way back over wide long on! Sweet sweet strike. He was down the track to get to the length and it made a sensational sound off the bat
stumped by a mile trying to go again! Clever bowling. Jhye jumped out early again, Santner saw it, dragged the length shorter and beat him comprehensively. Easy stumping for Seifert
